channel.title: Zune or i pod
channel.description:
Like the title says.
As for me, Zune ftw.

item.title: Zune or i pod
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
LamboMan:

I’m guessin that most people out here who still use ipods haven’t ever used a Zune (the latest ones) and that’s why they don’t know what they’re missing.

And it’s really sad that people still think that the click wheel actually makes navigation faster. If they ever use the Zune’s touchpad and the Twist interface, they’d surely agree that it’s like navigating at the speed of light when compared to the ‘fast’ click wheel and iPod UI.

As for the desktop software, Zune’s software totally pwns iTunes. It’s the easiest and most visually appealing way to organize and listen to your music, videos, pics etc.

Two years back i was going to buy an iPod. Thank God someone gifted me a Zune before i did.

A couple years back when I was running a bootleg torrent tracker and massively in to trading I did tend to try and push the idea of using flac on to other people but nowadays I don’t give a damn what other people use or listen to. It doesn’t affect me.

Same as Apple vs PC and Chrome vs IE8 vs FF vs Opera arguments. Do what you want.

bscly

Read full topic

item.title: Zune or i pod
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
I saw an archos touch screen type thing in the newspaper today. 120 GB, 350 CAD, which means it’s probably my next device.
I was going with ipod classic until this thing came along. I’ll probably check out some reviews and stuff of it, but it looks like it’s pretty good.

Read full topic

I prefer my iPaq because it’s a real PDA, not a cheap copy.

item.title: Zune or i pod
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Well the iphone looks like a bar of soap and a PDA had a retarded child together. And the zune looks like a shiny brick.

Also, I wanna say that this is just my personal opinion, it may be exaggerated, but that’s simply because it’s on the internet. Personally, I would go to the store and buy the player I want, I wouldn’t ask other people on a message board to choose one for me. Are we your parents or something?

Read full topic

item.title: Zune or i pod
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
NavMan:

I don’t think the zune even made it to australia.

Correctamundo

sersoft:

@this thread:

Also it’s alot more stylish IMO, everyone has an ipod, if not they have a zune, but the archos looks alot better, almost professional.


https://www.ubergizmo.com/photos/2008/1/Archos-605-wifi-02-468.jpg
https://www.toddklindt.com/Pictures/archos-605.jpg

And the 800x480 screen pwns apple’s 480x320.

The Archos has cool features and all but you can’t say it looks better or haha, professional. It looks cheap and plasticy

item.title: Zune or i pod
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

the Doom soundtrack

well I actually have doom and doom2 (the real game, full .wad file) on my sansa, and it’s about the same size as your mp3 player, just more thick because of the cell phone battery glued to it.

I get almost 48 hours of non-stop music between charges…

Read full topic

item.title: Zune or i pod
item.dc:creator: Kaze
item.description:
I only really bought my iPod because it was like $200 for 120GB which was a damn good deal at the time considering the extra features it provides over most other non-mainstream players.

Read full topic

item.title: Zune or i pod
item.dc:creator: TheOneAndOnly
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

I only use it listen to Jazz, the Doom soundtrack, and what used to be New Wave.

I’d rather doodle or read than poke a $300 piece of plastic for thirty minutes.

I think I’m in love with you.

As I said before, I’ve got this:

I like my IRiver E100 because it is PINK. And also because it isn’t annoyingly small - at least, I can comfortably push the buttons with my wildly clumsy fingers. It only has 2 GB, but I added a 4 GB microSD memory card, which I mainly use to store videos. I’ve got the entire Freeman’s Mind series in there.

Better than the iPod shuffle, in my humble opinion. I really like yours, Ramirezoid. And my dad might like it as well, that’s for sure. I might have to buy one of those

Read full topic

item.title: Zune or i pod
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
I’ve got this thing:

It’s only got 2 gigs in it, which is enough because I only use it listen to Jazz, the Doom soundtrack, and what used to be New Wave.

I’d rather doodle or read than poke a $300 piece of plastic for thirty minutes.

Read full topic

item.title: Zune or i pod
item.dc:creator: TheOneAndOnly
item.description:
That’s true. My dad has been pestering me lately because he wants a portable MP3 player, but he says he wants no itty-bitty, teeny-weeny iPod shuffle. It’s been nightmarishly hard to find one that’s the size of a Sony Ericsson Z310a cellphone, which is what my dad is after.

item.description:

Apple tricks people into buying their overpriced products by attracting people with useless crap like that…

I’d rather zoom in and zoom out my photos without using two fingers to smudge the screen…

item.title: Zune or i pod
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
sersoft:

google is your friend, and I don’t think it has multi-touch, linux is a desktop OS and I doubt the kernel has been adapted to multi touch yet.

multi-touch depends more on the touchscreen, some work with pressure and some others with the conductivity of the human skin.
the first one doesn’t support multitouch.
My iPod has multitouch

item.title: Zune or i pod

item.description:
@this thread:

sersoft:

Why would you even consider the ipood/zune? Buy an archos, all your problems solved, it’s 160gb, an awesome screen, wifi, touchscreen, hd videos, and it runs linux.

Also it’s alot more stylish IMO, everyone has an ipod, if not they have a zune, but the archos looks alot better, almost professional.

1629×1303 608 KB

https://www.ubergizmo.com/photos/2008/1/Archos-605-wifi-02-468.jpg
https://www.toddklindt.com/Pictures/archos-605.jpg

And the 800x480 screen pwns apple’s 480x320.

item.title: Zune or i pod
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
I have a 60-gig Zune HDD second-gen, and it’s pretty sweet. I’ve used iPods before, though, and I have to say that if Apple did one thing right, it’s the iPod. The touch wheel on that thing is basically unrivaled; if there’s one thing I can’t stand about my Zune, it’s the touchpad.

Read full topic
